title: Bug in inplace operation after expansion
body_html:
import torch

a = torch.ones(1,1) # same thing for rand(1,1) or zeros(1,1)
b = a.expand(4,5)
print(b)
b += 1
print(b) # expect all elements to be 2; however, all elements will be 1 + 4*5*1 = 21

Essentially, the inplace addition operation adds to the same memory space many times (4 x 5 = 20 times in the case above).
